intro: Baphia dewevrei var. inequalis, commonly known as the unequal baphia, is a flowering plant native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist forest habitats and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its seeds are encased in elongated pods, which contribute to its ecological role in nutrient cycling within its native environment.
